contentrichtext.text: '''Cavino Michele "Kelly" Petillo''',<ref>"The Talk of Gasoline Alley" 10780-WIBC, May 23, 2003</ref> (December 5, 1903 [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] â€“ June 30, 1970 [[Los Angeles, California]]) was an [[United States|American]] [[race car]] driver. Petillo competed in the [[Indianapolis 500]] on ten occasions, winning the race in 1935 in a year that marked the first win by a car powered by an [[Offenhauser]] engine. Petillo went on to win that year's [[Champcars|United States National Driving Championship]]. In 1937 Petillo participated in the [[Vanderbilt Cup]] but engine problems forced him out of the race.
